400.description: Bad Request: indicates that the server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (for example, malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing)

401.description: Unauthorized: indicates that the client request has not been completed because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the requested resource

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Filter on IDs or symbols of the currency

parameters.name: scoreProvider
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: scoreInBelow
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: scoreOutBelow
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: scoreExclusive
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: onlyPositiveBalance
parameters.description: Set this parameter to true to get only addresses with a positive unconfirmed balance

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Set this parameter to select the type on which you want to sort.The types accepted yet are: BALANCE and ADDRESSID

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Set this parameter to ASC to get the addresses sorted in ascending order or DESC to get them in descending order.

parameters.name: balanceBelow
parameters.description: Filter addresses and keep only addresses with a balance below the threshold.

parameters.name: balanceAbove
parameters.description: Filter addresses and keep only addresses with a balance above the threshold.

parameters.name: coinfirmScoreGreater
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: chainalysisScoreGreater
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use scoreFilter instead.

parameters.name: tagIDs
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a 'OR' combination of tag IDs

parameters.name: addressIds
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a list of address IDs.

parameters.name: nfts
parameters.description: One of include / exclude / only depending on whether you want to include addresses of type NFTs (or you want only those)

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a list of blockchain addresses (hashes).The blockchain needs to be specified when using this filter.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scoreProvider
parameters.description: Specify the score provider to filter on, or empty.Each provider has associated filter parameters that can be set.Supported values: `scorechain`, `coinfirm`, `chainalysis`, `elliptic`, `trmlabs`

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreInBelow
parameters.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain incoming score threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreOutBelow
parameters.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain outgoing score threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreExclusive
parameters.description: By default when both Scorechain scores scoreInBelow and scoreOutBelow are provided, it returns the addresses matching (scoreInBelow AND scoreOutBelow). When scoreExclusive is set to true, it will return the addresses matching (scoreInBelow OR scoreOutBelow).

parameters.name: scoreFilter.coinfirmFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a Coinfirm C-score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.chainalysisFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a Chainalysis risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.ellipticFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with an Elliptic risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.trmlabsFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with an TRM Labs risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: attributeFiltersJson
parameters.description: A JSON representation of a list of AttributeFilter objects. The filters are combined with an attributeFiltersOperator ('OR' by default). Each AttributeFilter can use different comparison operators: `=` (default if not specified), `<>` (not equal), `>` (greater than), `>=` (greater than or equal), `<` (less than), `<=` (less than or equal)

parameters.name: attributeFiltersOperator
parameters.description: Specifies how attribute filters are combined. Accepted values: 'OR' (default), 'AND'.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new address within a specified Wallet. All addresses _must_ be associated with a parent wallet. Addresses created with this endpoint are internal to Protect. To create an external address, you need to create a [whitelisted address request](https://docs.taurushq.com/protect-capital/reference/whitelistservice_createwhitelistedaddress).

For more information about whitelisted assets, see our [user guides](https://docs.taurushq.com/user-and-technical-guides/docs/smart-contracts).

Address creation requires HSM signature, which makes it synchronous. Therefore, address creation can be slow, and failures may occur if the HSM is either unavailable or takes too long to process. If this happens, the API can be safely called again.

**Required role:** AccountCreator.

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of addresses with light information filtered by a unique currency and a list of addresses. The light address information mainly contains the identifiers. There is no balance, risk score or attributes.

400.description: Bad Request: indicates that the server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (for example, malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing)

401.description: Unauthorized: indicates that the client request has not been completed because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the requested resource

403.description: Forbidden: indicates that the server understands the request but refuses to authorize it

404.description: Not Found: indicates that the server cannot find the requested resource

500.description: Internal Server Error: indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

503.description: Service Unavailable: indicates that the server is not ready to handle the request.

parameters.name: currencyID
parameters.description: One of the currencyID or uniqueCurrencyFilter fields must be provided

parameters.name: uniqueCurrencyFilter.blockchain
parameters.description: Required: The Blockchain to filter by (e.g. ETH, BTC). Can be found using the blockchain endpoint `/api/rest/v1/blockchains`

parameters.name: uniqueCurrencyFilter.network
parameters.description: Required: Network or environment the currency is used on (e.g. 'mainnet', 'testnet').

parameters.name: uniqueCurrencyFilter.tokenContractAddress
parameters.description: If this parameter is set, the currency returned will be a token with the specified contract address. If not set, the currency returned will be the native currency of the blockchain.

parameters.name: uniqueCurrencyFilter.tokenID
parameters.description: For some blockchains (ex. ALGO, XTZ) a tokenContractAddress might contain multiple assets. The tokenID is used to differentiate between those assets. If not set, the currency returned won't have any tokenID defined.

post.summary: Get the balance, at address level, for a specific asset
post.description:
Retrieve the address level balance for a specific asset.
An asset is identified by the `currency` parameter.
Optionally, set `kind` to "NFT" or "Unknown" for additional filtering.
If `kind` is "Unknown", the "unknown" object can further filter balances by blockchain, arg1, and arg2 (e.g., blockchain, contract number, and token ID).

post.description:
Taurus-PROTECT has a robust change approval system where each change must be approved by admins or in some cases, superadmins. This endpoint can be used to make change requests to users, wallets, whitelisted addresses, and more. 

This endpoint creates a new change which is then sent to admins or in some cases superadmins for approval. It is the same endpoint that powers the PROTECT web and desktop applications.  

Entities represent what is being changed. For example, a user, a group, a wallet, etc. The action represents what is being done to the entity. For example, creating a new user, updating an existing user, deleting a user, etc. Each entity can accept different fields which are passed to the API as JSON in the `changes` parameter. 

The following table lists the supported entities, actions and valid change fields.

## Entity Actions & Valid Change Fields

| `Entity`                  | `Supported Actions`                                                       | `Valid Change Fields`                                                                                                                                         |
|:---------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `User`                    | `create`, `update`, `delete`, `resetpassword`, `resettotp`, `resetkeycontainer` | `firstname`, `lastname`, `status`, `roles`, `externaluserid`, `username`, `publickey`, `email`, `userid`, `keycontainer`                                      |
| `Group`                   | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `externalgroupid`, `description`, `groupemail`                                                                                                         |
| `UserGroup`               | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `externalgroupid`, `description`                                                                                                                       |
| `Exchange`                | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `symbol`, `country`, `website`                                                                                                                         |
| `BusinessRule`            | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `rulekey`, `rulevalue`, `rulewalletid`                                                                                                                         |
| `Rule`                    | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `description`, `condition`, `action`                                                                                                                   |
| `Price`                   | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `blockchain`, `currencyfrom`, `currencyto`, `decimals`, `rate`, `source`, `currencyfromid`, `currencytoid`                                                    |
| `TPAction`                | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `label`, `autoApprove`, `trigger`, `tasks`, `state`                                                                                                            |
| `FeePayer`                | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `network`, `blockchain`, `address`                                                                                                                     |
| `SecurityDomain`          | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `description`, `mode`, `openid_configuration_url`                                                                                                      |
| `UserApiKey`              | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `key`, `description`, `permissions`                                                                                                                           |
| `VisibilityGroup`         | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `name`, `description`, `members`                                                                                                                              |
| `UserVisibilityGroup`     | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `userid`, `visibilitygroupid`                                                                                                                                  |
| `Wallet`                  | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `address`, `network`, `type`, `balance`                                                                                                                       |
| `WhitelistedAddress`      | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `address`, `network`, `type`, `description`                                                                                                                   |
| `ManualAccountFreeze`     | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `account`, `reason`, `duration`                                                                                                                               |
| `ManualUTXOFreeze`        | `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `utxo`, `reason`, `duration`                                                                                                                                  |
| `autotransfereventhandler`| `create`, `update`, `delete`                                                 | `monitored_wallet_id`, `payer_address_id`, `trigger_type`, `minimum_fiat_value_token`, `transfer_amount_factor_percentage`, `status`                          |

## Entity specific processing rules

The `changes` API implements CRUD semantics on various entities, where each entity type has its own processing rules. Here are some of the entity-specific rules that apply. Note that this list is non-exhaustive.

### All Entities

- You cannot create a change which already exists. The API will return an error.
- Once a change has been created, it cannot be edited. You must reject the change and create a new one.
- Once approved, changes are applied immediately by PROTECT.

### `User`

- Super admin users cannot be deleted.
- A user's `Super Admin` role cannot be removed.
- Only `firstname`, `lastname`, `email`, `username`, `status` and `roles` can be changed for Super Admin users.
- All users must have an `externalUserID` (typically an email address).

### `Groups`

- If SSO is enabled, groups changed via SCIM cannot be changed manually.
- Groups are automatically reset for SSO users on the next login, creating a change request.

### Account Freezes

- There are two different entities for account freezes (manualaccountbalancefreeze, manualutxofreeze) depending on if a blockchain is account based (e.g., Ethereum) or utxo based (e.g., Bitcoin). For examples on how to freeze funds see the [develop and integrate guide.](https://docs.taurushq.com/protect-capitalnull/null#freezing-funds-in-protect-1)

get.summary: Get the balance of the address
get.description:
Returns the MT535 statement of holdings for the address.
By default, the response is a JSON, with the swift content formatted in base64. To get the plain swift as a response, use the request header **'Accept: text/plain'**.
A date can be passed to get the balance at a particular date. If no date is given, the last closing date is used.

get.summary: Get the daily transactions of the address
get.description:
Returns the MT536 statement of transactions for the address.
By default, the response is a JSON, with the swift content formatted in base64. To get the plain swift as a response, use the request header **'Accept: text/plain'**.
A date can be passed to get the transactions of a particular day. If no date is given, the last day is used.

Reference: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7643#section-5

400.description: Bad Request: indicates that the server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (for example, malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing)

401.description: Unauthorized: indicates that the client request has not been completed because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the requested resource

403.description: Forbidden: indicates that the server understands the request but refuses to authorize it

404.description: Not Found: indicates that the server cannot find the requested resource

500.description: Internal Server Error: indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

503.description: Service Unavailable: indicates that the server is not ready to handle the request.

get.description:
This SCIM endpoint returns users based on a filter and pagination. The filter is a minimal one and currently doesn't support boolean operations. 
Reference (filter): https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2 
Reference (pagination): https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.4

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of transactions based on the provided query parameters.

You must specify either a `currency` (by ID or symbol) or a combination of `blockchain` and `network`.

- If `currency` is provided, `blockchain` and `network` cannot be used.
- If `currency` is not provided, you may use `blockchain`, `network`, or both together.

Only one of these approaches is allowed per request.

The `currencyID` is unique across blockchains and networks, and can be identified by querying the `/currencies` endpoint. We recommend using `currencyID` whenever possible to avoid ambiguity.

400.description: Bad Request: indicates that the server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (for example, malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing)

401.description: Unauthorized: indicates that the client request has not been completed because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the requested resource

403.description: Forbidden: indicates that the server understands the request but refuses to authorize it

404.description: Not Found: indicates that the server cannot find the requested resource

500.description: Internal Server Error: indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

503.description: Service Unavailable: indicates that the server is not ready to handle the request.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Filter on ID or symbol of the currency

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the transaction (e.g. `incoming`, `outgoing`)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filter by query string in any of the fields address, customerid, transactionid, hash, type.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of transactions returned per request. Max 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from which to begin selection of transactions.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Only return transactions from after this timestamp.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Only return transactions from before this timestamp.

parameters.name: transactionIds
parameters.description: Filter on Protect internal transactionID. This is purely internal and should rarely be used by clients

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of transactions to fetch (e.g. `burn`).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Returns only transaction that have this address as a source

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Returns only transaction that have this address as a destination

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Filter on Protect transaction ID, as visible in the transaction objects.

parameters.name: blockchain
parameters.description: The blockchain associated with the transactions (e.g. `ETH`, `BTC`)

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: The network the transaction took place in (e.g. `mainnet`, `testnet`).

parameters.name: fromBlockNumber
parameters.description: Only return transactions from after this block.

parameters.name: toBlockNumber
parameters.description: Only return transactions from before this block.

parameters.name: hashes
parameters.description: Filter on transaction hash, as visible in the transaction objects.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Returns only transaction that have this address as either a source or a destination

parameters.name: amountAbove
parameters.description: Returns only transactions with an amount strictly above the given amount

parameters.name: excludeUnknownSourceDestination
parameters.description: Returns only transactions with a known source and destination, default false

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Returns only transactions with a specific customer id

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new wallet.

You must specify either a `currency` (by ID or symbol) or a combination of `blockchain` and `network`.

- If `currency` is provided, `blockchain` and `network` cannot be used.
- If `currency` is not provided, you may use `blockchain`, `network`, or both together.

Only one of these approaches is allowed per request.

The `currencyID` is globally unique across blockchains and networks, and can be identified by querying the `/currencies` endpoint. We recommend using `currencyID` whenever possible to avoid ambiguity.

Required role: **AccountCreator**.

parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude wallets disabled by business rules. Defaults to false (disabled wallets included). Filtering will be performed after pagination, i.e. the number of returned items may be below `limit` if wallets on a page are disabled.

parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude wallets with a zero balance. Defaults to false (wallets with 0 balance included).

parameters.description: An optional list of IDs. The list can't exceed 100 elements.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: uint64; Return maximum `limit` items for a query; Max 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: uint64; Start retrieving items starting at `offset` id

parameters.name: exchangeAccountId
parameters.description: uint64; **Deprecated:** Use exchangeAccountIds instead

parameters.name: addressType
parameters.description: Can be one of the following: `individual`, `exchange`, `baker`, `stakepool`, `contract`, `validator`, node, `fiatprovider`

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Will find a match in any part of the value. Filter applies to the following fields: `customerid`, `address`, `blockchain`, `label`, `memo`, `addresstype`

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: **Deprecated:** Use `blockchain` instead

parameters.name: scoreProvider
parameters.description: **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead. Can be either of the following: `scorechain`, `coinfirm`, `chainalysis`, `elliptic`, `trmlabs`

parameters.name: scoreInBelow
parameters.description: numeric; **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead

parameters.name: scoreOutBelow
parameters.description: numeric; **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead

parameters.name: scoreExclusive
parameters.description: **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead

parameters.name: rulesContainerNormalized
parameters.description: Normalize rules containers in its own object

parameters.name: exchangeAccountIds
parameters.description: uint64; Array containing the list of IDs for exchange accounts

parameters.name: coinfirmScoreGreater
parameters.description: uint64; **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead

parameters.name: tagIDs
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a 'OR' combination of tag IDs

parameters.name: chainalysisScoreGreater
parameters.description: uint64; **Deprecated:** Use `scoreFilter` instead

parameters.name: contractType
parameters.description: **Deprecated:** Use `contractTypes` instead

parameters.name: allowedForAddressId
parameters.description: uint64; Filter addresses allowed to receive funds from this address id

parameters.name: allowedForWalletId
parameters.description: uint64; Filter addresses allowed to receive funds from this wallet id. Will be ignored if allowedForAddressId is filled

parameters.name: blockchain
parameters.description: Filter on the blockchain of the WLA.

parameters.name: includeForApproval
parameters.description: If true, include also addresses waiting for approval in the results.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Filter on the specific addresses to return. This field is using the blockchain's native address syntax

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Name of the blockchain network, eg. `mainnet`, `testnet`, or `sepolia`

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: uint64; List of IDs to return

parameters.name: tnParticipantID
parameters.description: uuid; UUID of the Taurus-NETWORK participant to whom the address belongs

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scoreProvider
parameters.description: Specify the score provider to filter on, or empty.Each provider has associated filter parameters that can be set.Supported values: `scorechain`, `coinfirm`, `chainalysis`, `elliptic`, `trmlabs`

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreInBelow
parameters.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain incoming score threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreOutBelow
parameters.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain outgoing score threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.scorechainFilters.scoreExclusive
parameters.description: By default when both Scorechain scores scoreInBelow and scoreOutBelow are provided, it returns the addresses matching (scoreInBelow AND scoreOutBelow). When scoreExclusive is set to true, it will return the addresses matching (scoreInBelow OR scoreOutBelow).

parameters.name: scoreFilter.coinfirmFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a Coinfirm C-score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.chainalysisFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with a Chainalysis risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.ellipticFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with an Elliptic risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: scoreFilter.trmlabsFilters.scoreGreater
parameters.description: Filter addresses with an TRM Labs risk score above threshold.

parameters.name: lastIncomingTxFromWhitelistedAddress
parameters.description: Filtered addresses with the last incoming transaction older than lastIncomingTransactionDate  won't appear in the result. The default value is never

parameters.name: contractTypes
parameters.description: Filter addresses by multiple Contract Types. Can be any of: `GENERIC`, `CMTA20`, `CMTA20-KYC`, `CMTA20-RULEENGINE`, `CMTAT`, `ERC20`, `DEFI`, `ERC2771-PROXY-ADMIN`, `TERC1155A`, `GSN_FORWARDER`, `OPEN_ZEPPELIN_FORWARDER`, `TAURUS_CONTRACT_CREATOR`, `SMARTPY-FA2`, `SMARTPY-FA12`, `ASA`, `FIGMENT_STAKING`

parameters.name: attributeFiltersJson
parameters.description: A JSON representation of a list of AttributeFilter objects. The filters are combined with an attributeFiltersOperator ('OR' by default). Each AttributeFilter can use different comparison operators: `=` (default if not specified), `<>` (not equal), `>` (greater than), `>=` (greater than or equal), `<` (less than), `<=` (less than or equal)

parameters.name: attributeFiltersOperator
parameters.description: Specifies how attribute filters are combined. Accepted values: 'OR' (default), 'AND'.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new whitelisted contracts.
For ETH, `tokenId` is left empty
For XTZ, `tokenId` is left empty for FA1.2 tokens and must have a value for FA2 tokens
For ALGO, we either need a tokenId which is the `assetId` for algorand, or we need a `contractAddress` (creator address) and a `symbol` (unit name), which will be used to identify the asset.
For XLM,  we need a valid `contractAddress` (Stellar address) and `tokenId` (Stellar asset code).For ICP, we need a valid `contractAddress` (valid ICP principal).Required role: **WhitelistedAddressCreator**.

prefix.description: An identifier of the signing protocol version

nonce.description: The nonce associated to the API key (to avoid replay)

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the request - used to reject too old or future requests

method.description: The HTTP method of the request

host.description: The host property of the request

path.description: The path property of the request

query.description: The query property of the request

contentType.description: The contentType property of the request

body.description: The body of the request (through the REST API, the bytes are encoded as a base64 string)

signature.description: The submitted HMAC signature for the request, which we need to validate (through the REST API, the bytes are encoded as a base64 string)
The signature of the protobuf-serialized ApiRequestToValidate message, that uses the shared JWT secret (through the REST API, the bytes are encoded as a base64 string)

sourceSharedAddressID.description: The shared address ID representing the internal address where the collateral is held. A pledge will be created from this address to the lender participant.

currencyID.description: The currency ID of the collateral

amount.description: numeric; Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

minimumDuration.description: The minimum duration of the pledge. The minimum duration is the time that the pledge must remain active before it can be unpledged. (example 1 month, the owner can't unpledge before one month)You can either set endOfMinimumDurationDate or minimumDuration. If endOfMinimumDurationDate is set, minimumDuration will be inferred from endOfMinimumDurationDate. Example of value: '86400s' for 1 day.

endOfMinimumDurationDate.description: The end date of the minimum duration of the pledge. The minimum duration is the time that the pledge must remain active before it can be unpledged.You can either set endOfMinimumDurationDate or minimumDuration. If endOfMinimumDurationDate is set, minimumDuration will be inferred from endOfMinimumDurationDate.

noticePeriodDuration.description: The duration of the notice period occuring after doing an unpledge.When an unpledge is performed, the target participant will be able to perform withdrawals until the end of the notice period. (example 48h after the unpledge)When this field is not set, the pledge is considered 'At sight', so the owner can unpledge at anytime and the target can't withdraw anymore. Example of value: '86400s' for 1 day.

providedOnly.description: Optional filter to return only Taurus provided Contract Templates.

auditedOnly.description: Optional filter to return only Contract Templates marked as audited.

nameSearch.description: Optionally Search Contract Templates by name. Example: 'erc' will match ['erc20', 'TERC', 'E-RC', 'e_rc', 'e.r.c'] etc.

contractTemplateTypes.description: Optional filter on specified Contract Template types.

ids.description: uint64; the list of addresses to be signed by the cold HSM.

values.description: Filter for specific workflows, identified by their UUIDs

states.description: Filters workflows by state, applicable only when a specific workflow type is set

status.description: Filter on workflow status, can be 'active' or 'completed'

signature.description: signature of the entities' metadata, encoded in base64

destinationAddressId.description: Destination address to trigger for auto-transfer, it needs to be part of the handler's monitored wallet.

scoreGreater.description: Filter addresses with a Chainalysis risk score above threshold.

scoreGreater.description: Filter addresses with a Coinfirm C-score above threshold.

ScoreFilterCoinfirmFilters.description: The c-score of Coinfirm is between 0 (lowest risk, good) to 100 (highest risk, bad).

scoreGreater.description: Filter addresses with an Elliptic risk score above threshold.

ScoreFilterEllipticFilters.description: The risk score of Elliptic is between 0 (lowest risk, good) to 100 (highest risk, bad).

scoreInBelow.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain incoming score threshold.

scoreOutBelow.description: Filter addresses under a Scorechain outgoing score threshold.

scoreExclusive.description: By default when both Scorechain scores scoreInBelow and scoreOutBelow are provided, it returns the addresses matching (scoreInBelow AND scoreOutBelow). When scoreExclusive is set to true, it will return the addresses matching (scoreInBelow OR scoreOutBelow).

ScoreFilterScorechainFilters.description: The risk score of Scorechain is between 0 (highest risk, bad) to 100 (lowest risk, good).

scoreGreater.description: Filter addresses with an TRM Labs risk score above threshold.

ScoreFilterTRMLabsFilters.description: The risk score of TRM Labs is between 0 (lowest risk, good) to 100 (highest risk, bad).

amount.description: numeric; Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

name.description: The name of the attachment to create.

value.description: The content of the attachment to create, encoded as a base64 string.

contentType.description: The content type of the attachment to create. Example: application/pdf

type.description: The type of the attachment to create. It is used to specify whether the attachment is embedded in the value itself or if it is a link to an externally hosted resource. Possible values are: 'EMBEDDED', 'EXTERNAL_LINK'.

attributeData.description: The data of the attribute to create (key, value, type etc...).

shareToTaurusNetworkParticipant.description: Set to true to share the attribute with the Taurus-NETWORK participant linked to the participantID.

destinationSharedAddressID.description: The shared address ID representing the address where the withdrawn funds will be sent. The address must be shared with the participant owning the pledge.

amount.description: numeric; Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

defaultDestinationSharedAddressID.description: The default destination shared address ID. This is the address where the funds will be sent on withdrawals. The address must be shared with the participant owning the pledge.

defaultDestinationInternalAddressID.description: The default destination internal address ID. This is the address where the funds will be sent on withdrawals. The ID represents an internal address which must be shared with the participant owning the pledge.

amount.description: numeric; Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

destinationInternalAddressID.description: Use either destinationInternalAddressID or destinationSharedAddressID. destinationInternalAddressID should represent an internal address that is shared with the participant owning the pledge.

externalReferenceID.description: Identifier for the withdrawal in the user's system. This must be unique. Attempting to create a withdrawal with an existing externalReferenceID will do nothing and return the originally existing withdrawal

minimumDuration.description: The minimum duration of the pledge. The minimum duration is the time that the pledge must remain active before it can be unpledged. (example 1 month, the owner can't unpledge before one month)You can either set endOfMinimumDurationDate or minimumDuration.

endOfMinimumDurationDate.description: The end date of the minimum duration of the pledge. The minimum duration is the time that the pledge must remain active before it can be unpledged.You can either set endOfMinimumDurationDate or minimumDuration.

noticePeriodDuration.description: The duration of the notice period occuring after doing an unpledge.When an unpledge is performed, the target participant will be able to perform withdrawals until the end of the notice period. (example 48h after the unpledge)When this field is not set, the pledge is considered 'At sight', so the owner can unpledge at anytime and the target can't withdraw anymore.

endOfNoticePeriodDate.description: The end date of the notice period. The notice period is the time that the target participant can perform withdrawals after the unpledge is done by the owner participant.After the end of the notice period, the target participant can't perform withdrawals anymore and the pledge is considered 'UNPLEDGED'. This field is set once an unpledge action is performed.

status.title: The webhook status can be updated to "enabled" or "disabled"

decimals.description: Number of decimal places to consider as minimum unit of transfer

Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

googlerpcStatus.description:
- Simple to use and understand for most users
- Flexible enough to meet unexpected needs

# Overview

The `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message,
and error details. The error code should be an enum value of
[google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code], but it may accept additional error codes if needed.  The
error message should be a developer-facing English message that helps
developers *understand* and *resolve* the error. If a localized user-facing
error message is needed, put the localized message in the error details or
localize it in the client. The optional error details may contain arbitrary
information about the error. There is a predefined set of error detail types
in the package `google.rpc` that can be used for common error conditions.

# Language mapping

The `Status` message is the logical representation of the error model, but it
is not necessarily the actual wire format. When the `Status` message is
exposed in different client libraries and different wire protocols, it can be
mapped differently. For example, it will likely be mapped to some exceptions
in Java, but more likely mapped to some error codes in C.

# Other uses

The error model and the `Status` message can be used in a variety of
environments, either with or without APIs, to provide a
consistent developer experience across different environments.

Example uses of this error model include:

- Partial errors. If a service needs to return partial errors to the client,
    it may embed the `Status` in the normal response to indicate the partial
    errors.

- Workflow errors. A typical workflow has multiple steps. Each step may
    have a `Status` message for error reporting.

- Batch operations. If a client uses batch request and batch response, the
    `Status` message should be used directly inside batch response, one for
    each error sub-response.

- Asynchronous operations. If an API call embeds asynchronous operation
    results in its response, the status of those operations should be
    represented directly using the `Status` message.

- Logging. If some API errors are stored in logs, the message `Status` could
    be used directly after any stripping needed for security/privacy reasons.
googlerpcStatus.title:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different
programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by
[gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). The error model is designed to be:

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

addressPath.description: The derivation path for the address, used to generate the address from the seed.

addressIndex.description: uint64; Index used for address generation. Required for derivation paths.

address.description: The actual address generated for the wallet.

alternateAddress.description: An alternate address that can be used for transactions, if available.

comment.description: An optional comment associated with the address.

label.description: A user-friendly label for the address (e.g., 'Deposit Address'). Displayed as `Name` in the UI.

customerId.description: Identifier for the customer associated with the address.

nonce.description: uint64; The current nonce of the address. A nonce is a 32-bit (or 4-byte) number used to prevent replay attacks.

balance.description: Balance associated with the address, including confirmed and unconfirmed amounts.

scores.description: Risk score related to the address, pulled from external reputation services. (e.g., Scorechain, Chainalysis, etc...).

attributes.description: Additional attributes and metadata associated with the address.

linkedWhitelistedAddressIds.description: List of whitelisted address IDs that are linked to this address.

updateDate.description: The date and time when the address was last updated.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the address is disabled.

canUseAllFunds.description: Indicates whether all funds in the address can be used.

externalAddressId.description: An optional external identifier for the address.

status.description: Status of address creation. Creating status is used for asynchronous address creation. Value is one of `created`, `creating, `signed`, `observed`, or `confirmed`.

key.description: A key that Protect assigns to the attribute. E.g., `legacyAddress` `has_any_transactions`, etc...

owner.description: Owner of the attribute. Most commonly `system` or `user`.

isfile.description: Indicates whether the attribute is a file.

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

signatures.description: The number of pledge actions that were successfully approved.

The signature must be created using the private key associated with the participant's TLS certificate.base64(ecdsa_sign(sha256([hex(sha256(pledgeAction1_metadata)),hex(sha256(pledgeAction2_metadata)),hex(sha256(pledgeAction3_metadata))])))

type.description:
Address type, specific to the blockchain being used.

For BTC & LTC, valid values are ``p2pkh``, ``p2sh_p2wpkh``, or ``p2wpkh``. Defaults to ``p2sh_p2wpkh`` if empty.

For DOGE, value must be ``p2pkh``. Will default to ``p2pkh`` if empty.

For all other blockchains, this field must be empty.

amount.description: Amount of the selling asset to sell, in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. For example, 1 corresponds to 1 'stroop' (one ten-millionth of XLM), and 1 XLM corresponds to 10000000 (7 decimals). If set to 0, deletes the offer identified by `offerID`

buyingAssetID.description: Specify asset to be bought in the offer. Leave empty for XLM native

buyingAssetIssuer.description: Specify asset to be bought in the offer. Leave Empty for XLM native

price.description: Price of 1 unit of selling in terms of buying, as a string representing a floating point number. For example, if you wanted to sell 30 XLM and buy 5 BTC, the price would be 5/30 = '0.1666667'

offerID.description: ID of the offer to be modified. If 0, a new offer is created. Cannot be set if isPassive is true

isPassive.description: If true, creates a Passive Sell offer that will not consume a counter offer that exactly matches this offer. This is useful for offers meant to be 1:1 exchanges for path payments

sharedAddressID.description: The shared address ID representing the internal address where the pledged funds will be held.

amount.description: numeric; Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

pledgeType.description:
The type of the pledge regarding the withdrawal rights. Possible values are: 'NO_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS', 'PLEDGEE_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS', 'PLEDGEE_AUTO_APPROVED_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS'

'NO_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS' means that the target participant has no right to withdraw from the pledge.

'PLEDGEE_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS' means that the target participant can request withdrawals from the pledge that must be approved by the owner participant.

'PLEDGEE_AUTO_APPROVED_WITHDRAWALS_RIGHTS' means that the target participant can request withdrawals from the pledge that are automatically approved without the owner participant approval, if the owner approved the setuped governance rules.

keyValueAttributes.description: Optional key-value attributes to attach to the pledge.

externalReferenceId.description: Reference identifier for the pledge that will be shared to the counter participant.

reconciliationNote.description: Reconciliation note used internally, not shared to the counter participant.

currency.description: This can be a currency name or a currency ID. Needs to be the native currency of a blockchain.

name.description: The name of the wallet has to be unique per blockchain, network.

isOmnibus.description: When set to `true`, the Wallet can be used as source of transactions allowing the system to pick addresses with adequate funds. (This is called *Single owner* in the GUI)

comment.description: Comment or description of the wallet (maximum 254 characters). It is not used or interpreted by the system and will be returned as is in the replies from endpoints such as `api/rest/v2/wallets`

customerId.description: When *isOmnibus* is `true`, all addresses in the wallet will have this attribute set (maximum 254 characters)

blockchain.description: A string identifying the blockchain (e.g. "BTC"). Required if currency is empty. If the blockchain is enabled on more than one network (e.g. "mainnet" and "testnet"), the network needs to be specified.

network.description: A string identifying the network. Required if the specified blockchain is enabled on multiple networks

visibilityGroupID.description: The UUID of a Visibility Group (uuid can be obtained from e.g. `api/rest/v1/visibilitygroups`). The created wallet will only be visible and can only be managed by users in this group.

externalWalletId.description: An optional external identifier for the wallet.

address.description: Required: The address you wish to whitelist. Must be a valid address for the desired blockchain and network.

memo.description: A memo to apply to the desired whitelisted address.

label.description: Required: A label to apply to the desired whitelisted address.

exchangeAccountId.description: uint64; The id of an exchange account. There is a single exchange account per currency, per exchange

customerId.description: The id of the customer to associate with this address.

linkedInternalAddressIds.description: uint64 Array, An array of address ids to attach to this address, must match the blockchain of the linked addresses and they must not belong omnibus wallets.

contractType.description: The type of contract to associate with this address (ex. CMTA20, GENERIC).

linkedWalletIds.description: uint64 Array; An array of wallets to attach to this address.

blockchain.description: Required: The symbol of the blockchain of which to whitelist an address. (ex. eth, btc)

network.description: The network of the blockchain the whitelisted address belongs to (ex. mainnet).

visibilityGroupID.description: The id of the visibility group to place the address in. You must be able to see this visibility group.

blockchain.description: Symbol of the blockchain on which to whitelist a contract. Examples: `BTC`, `ADA`, `SOL` ...

contractAddress.description:
Address of the smart contract.
For ALGO standard assets, this is the address of the creator of the asset.

For XLM, this is the Stellar address.

For ICP, this is the ICP principal.

symbol.description:
Symbol of the token.
For ALGO it is the unit name of the standard asset.

decimals.description: Number of decimal places to consider as minimum unit of transfer.

tokenId.description:
Unused for ETH and Polygon.
For XTZ, this is used to create a FA2 token.
For ALGO standard assets, this is the globally unique asset id.

network.description: Name of the blockchain network, eg. `mainnet`, `testnet`, or `sepolia`.

coinTypeIndex.description: Index used to identify the coin type in BIP44. (e.g. Bitcoin is 0, Ethereum is 60).

blockchain.description: The Blockchain the currency is associated with, (e.g. ETH, BTC).

isToken.description: Indicates if the currency is a token (e.g., ERC-20).

isERC20.description: Indicates if the token is an ERC-20 token.

decimals.description: Number of decimal places the currency uses (e.g. 18 for ETH).

contractAddress.description: Smart contract address if currency is a smart contract (e.g. ERC-20.).

hasStaking.description: Indicates if the currency supports staking.

isUTXOBased.description: Indicates if the currency is UTXO-based (e.g. Bitcoin).

isAccountBased.description: Indicates if the currency is account-based (e.g. Ethereum).

isFiat.description: Indicates if the currency is a fiat currency (e.g. CHF, EUR, USD).

isFA12.description: Indicates if the currency is based on FA12 standard (used in Tezos).

isFA20.description: Indicates if the currency is based on FA20 standard (used in Tezos).

isNFT.description: Indicates if the currency represents a Non-Fungible Token (NFT).

enabled.description: Indicates if the currency is enabled in the current tenant.

displayName.description: Display name for the currency, (e.g. Ethereum, Bitcoin).

type.description: Type of the currency. Can be `token`, `fiat`, `native` , or `signet`.

wlcaId.description: White listed contract address id associated with the currency.

network.description: Network or environment the currency is used on (e.g. 'mainnet', 'testnet').

tokenID.description: Unique id for the token, if applicable (e.g. for NFTs).

logo.description: Currency logo in Data URI scheme. Base 64 encoded. (e.g. data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==).

ratio.description: The loan to value ratio of the lending offer, based on 2 decimals. Example: 12500 corresponds to my collateral shall be worth 125% of my loan

signatures.title: signatures of a json serialized string ({"blockchain":"ETH","currencyFrom":"BNB","currencyTo":"CHF","decimals":18, "value":"123.1000"}) by user with the role "priceupdater"

avgBalancePerAddress.description: Balance in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

forkMigratedAt.description: Empty when DOT hasn't migrated to AssetHub

outgoingDefaultSharedAddresses.description: The TN shared addresses designated by me to be shared to other participants

incomingDefaultSharedAddresses.description: The TN shared addresses designated by other participant to share to me

status.description: Status of address creation. Creating status is used for asynchronous address creation. Value is one of `created`, `creating, `signed`, `observed`, or `confirmed`.

currencyId.description: Currency associated with the address (e.g., ETH, BTC). For a list of enabled currencies, query the [currencies endpoint](https://docs.taurushq.com/protect-capital/reference/walletservice_getcurrencies).

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

amountMainUnit.description: Amount in the main currency unit (e.g. A BTC transaction will use the BTC value here instead of SAT)

symbol.description: The symbol returned with the fee amount if provided.

signedPayloadHash.description: The hex encoded SHA256 hash of the payload. The SHA256 hash is sliced to take the first 30 bytes out of 32. The total length after hex encoding is 60 characters. This hash will be provided to the proof of reserve challenge concatenated with a 'TN-' Taurus-NETWORK domain prefix.

signedPayloadAsString.description: The signed payload as a string. This field is used to to obtain the hash.

type.description: Indicates the type of PoR. The 'stake' fields are only relevant when the type is 'ADA'. For the 'Generic' case they must be ignored.

requestStatus.description: The status of the request at the time of the event. One of the following: `CREATED`, `APPROVING`, `APPROVED`, `HSM_SIGNED`, `HSM_READY`, `BROADCASTING`, `BROADCASTED`, `CONFIRMED`, `REJECTED`

totalBalance.description: Balance in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

totalBalanceValuation.description: Valuation in the base currency main unit (CHF, EUR, USD etc...)

totalValuation.description: Valuation in the base currency main unit (CHF, EUR, USD etc...)

annualPercentageYield.description: The interest rate of the to create lending offer, based on 5 decimals. Example: 525000 corresponds to 5.25% annual percentage yield

shield.title:
base64 of a json string containing the shield version and a 
signature from the participant private key of selected attribute of the 'Participant' payload

ownedSharedAddressesCount.description: Count of shared addresses where the participant is the owner.

targetedSharedAddressesCount.description: Count of shared addresses where the participant is the target.

outgoingTotalPledgesValuationBaseCurrenc.description: Total valuation of all outgoing pledges in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF).

incomingTotalPledgesValuationBaseCurrenc.description: Total valuation of all incoming pledges in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF).

attributeDescription.title: how to get this value ex. TDX subaccount

supportedBlockchains.description: List of supported blockchains and networks for the participant. This is used to determine which blockchains and networks the participant can interact with.

wladdressID.description: Represent the id of a whitelisted address if your participant is the target participant of the pledge. internalAddressID and wladdressID can not be set simultaneously.

outgoingPledgesAmount.title: total in currency unit of all outgoing pledges to THIS counterparty participant for THIS currency

outgoingPledgesValuationBaseCurrency.title: total in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF) of all outgoing pledges to THIS counterparty participant for THIS currency

incomingPledgesAmount.title: total in currency unit of all incoming pledges from THIS counterparty participant for THIS currency

incomingPledgesValuationBaseCurrency.title: total in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF) of all incoming pledges from THIS counterparty participant for THIS currency

outgoingPledgesTotalValuationBaseCurrenc.title: total in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF) of all outgoing pledges to THIS counterparty participant for all currencies

incomingPledgesTotalValuationBaseCurrenc.title: total in base currency in main unit (ex. CHF) of all incoming pledges from THIS counterparty participant for all currencies

id.description: The unique identifier of the shared address (uuid).

internalAddressID.description: Represent the id of a deposit address if your participant is the owner participant of the shared address. internalAddressID and wladdressID can not be set simultaneously.

wladdressID.description: Represent the id of a whitelisted address if your participant is the target participant of the shared address. can be empty if the whitelisted address is not yet created or was rejected. internalAddressID and wladdressID can not be set simultaneously.

pledgesCount.description: Count of active pledges linked to the shared address.

wlContractAddressID.description: Represent the id of a whitelisted contract address.

id.description: A unique identifier for the transaction

currency.description: The symbol or unique id of the currency the transaction used (e.g. `ETH`)

sources.description: The addresses that sent currency for this transaction.

destinations.description: The addresses that received currency for this transaction.

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

amountMainUnit.description: Amount in the main currency unit (e.g. A BTC transaction will use the BTC value here instead of SAT)

fee.description: The fee associated with the transaction if there is one. In the smallest currency unit.

feeMainUnit.description: The fee associated with the transaction if there is one. In the main currency unit.

hash.description: The hash of the transaction as returned by the chain.

block.description: The block number associated with the transaction.

receptionDate.description: When the transaction was received by the blockchain.

confirmationDate.description: When the transaction was fully confirmed.

uniqueId.description: A unique id for the transaction.

blockchain.description: The blockchain associated with the transaction (e.g. `ETH`, `BTC`)

arg1.description: If set, serves as a sub-identifier to the blockchain field for the type of resource this transaction relates to. Typically a contract address.

arg2.description: If set, serves as a sub-identifier to the arg1 field for the type of resource this transaction relates to. Typically a token ID.

currencyInfo.description: The currency used in the transaction.

network.description: The network the transaction took place in (e.g. `mainnet`, `testnet`).

requestId.description: If set, contains the request ID that this transaction originated from.

confirmationBlock.description: The block that the transaction was confirmed by.

requestVisible.description: Indicates whether the requestId value refers to a request that is visible to the user.

travelRule.description: Travel rule data provides information about the originator and the beneficiary of the transaction.

status.description: The current status of the transaction, [`NEW`, `SUCCESS`, `PENDING`, `TEMPORARY_FAILURE`, `INVALID`, `TIMEOUT`, `MINED`, `LOST`, `EXPIRED`]

platformFees.description: Any Platform fees on the transaction such as exchange withdrawals.

attributes.description: A list of key-value transaction attributes.

forkNumber.description: The forkNumber is used in case a blockchain uses a new platform and starts over with a new genesis hash. For instance it is set to 1 on the new DOT AssetHub platform, otherwise it is 0 in most cases.

fees.description: List of the fees of the transaction with corresponding assets.

isConfirmed.description: True if the transaction is fully confirmed, false otherwise.

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

amountMainUnit.description: Amount in the main currency unit (e.g. A BTC transaction will use the BTC value here instead of SAT)

currency.description: The symbol or unique id of the associated currency (e.g. `ETH`)

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit, based on the currency decimals. Example: 1500000000000000000 WEI (smallest ETH unit) corresponds to 1.5 ETH (ETH has 18 decimals places)

amountMainUnit.description: Amount in the main currency unit (e.g. A BTC transaction will use the BTC value here instead of SAT)

blockchain.description: The identifier of the associated blockchain (e.g. `ETH`, `BTC`)

originatorPersonTravelRuleData.description: OriginatorPersonTravelRuleData is used when the originator of a transaction is a physical person.

originatorCompanyTravelRuleData.description: OriginatorCompanyTravelRuleData is used when the originator of a transaction is a legal entity.

beneficiaryCompanyTravelRuleData.description: BeneficiaryCompanyTravelRuleData is used when the beneficiary of a transaction is a legal entity.

beneficiaryPersonTravelRuleData.description: BeneficiaryPersonTravelRuleData is used when the beneficiary of a transaction is a physical person.

provider.description: Provider is the type of the travel rule data provider. Supported provider: 'TaurusNetwork'

reservedByRequestId.description: reservedByRequestId has been replaced by reservationId since 3.22. It will always be empty since 3.22.

blockchain.description: Required: The Blockchain to filter by (e.g. ETH, BTC). Can be found using the blockchain endpoint `/api/rest/v1/blockchains`

network.description: Required: Network or environment the currency is used on (e.g. 'mainnet', 'testnet').

tokenContractAddress.description: If this parameter is set, the currency returned will be a token with the specified contract address. If not set, the currency returned will be the native currency of the blockchain.

tokenID.description: For some blockchains (ex. ALGO, XTZ) a tokenContractAddress might contain multiple assets. The tokenID is used to differentiate between those assets. If not set, the currency returned won't have any tokenID defined.

pledgeActionID.description: The ID of the pledge action to be approved to finalize the unpledge action.

prices.description: Prices to be updated. Required price fields are: blockchain, currencyFrom, currencyTo, decimals, rate, signatures.

jwt.description: A valid JWT for the user who made the original request

externalWalletId.description: An optional external identifier for the wallet.

tgvalidatordWallet.title:
Deprecated: Wallets can have thousands of addresses. It is not a good idea to serialize a wallet with all its addresses.
Generally, WalletInfo should be used instead

externalWalletId.description: An optional external identifier for the wallet.

pledgeWithdrawalID.description: The ID of the pledge withdrawal.

pledgeActionID.description: The ID of the pledge action to be approved to finalize the withdrawal creation.

SponsoredByAddressID.description: (XLM Blockchain Field) If set, is the ID of the address who will sponsor the cost of the operation on the minimum balance of the source address
